response:
To run the Ansible playbook, follow these steps:

1. Change to the directory where the playbook is located:
```
cd Test-Drive-Automation
```
2. Pull the latest changes from the repository:
```
git pull
```
3. Run the playbook:
```
ansible-playbook start-lab.yml
```
This will execute the instructions in the playbook, which include configuring loopback addresses, bonds, bridges, access ports, SVIs, and VRR on the specified interfaces.

To configure loopback addresses on leaf01, you can use the following command:
```
nv set interface lo ip address 10.255.255.1/32
```
This will assign a loopback address of 10.255.255.1/32 to the loopback interface on leaf01.

To configure loopback addresses on leaf02, you can use the following command:
```
nv set interface lo ip address 10.255.255.2/32
```
This will assign a loopback address of 10.255.255.2/32 to the loopback interface on leaf02.

query: Configure bridge and access ports on leaf01
response:
To configure bridge and access ports on leaf01, you can use the following commands:
```
nv set bridge domain br_default vlan 10,20
nv set interface swp1,bond0 bridge domain br_default
nv set interface swp1 bridge domain br_default access 10
nv config apply
```
This will configure the bridge domain `br_default` on vlan 10 and 20, and set the interface `swp1` as a member of the bond and configure it as an access port on the bridge domain `br_default` with VLAN 10.

query: Configure bridge and access ports on leaf02
response:
To configure bridge and access ports on leaf02, you can use the following commands:
```
nv set bridge domain br_default vlan 10,20
nv set interface swp2,bond0 bridge domain br_default
nv set interface swp2 bridge domain br_default access 20
nv config apply
```
This will configure the bridge domain br\_default on vlan 10 and 20, and set the swp2 interface as a member of the bond0 interface, which is a bridge interface. The swp2 interface will also be configured as an access port on the br\_default bridge domain with a VLAN of 20.
